content.question: At time <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, a train on a horizontal track has speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> and acceleration <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math>. A short time later, time <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, the train has speed <math alttext="2 v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>v</mi></math> and acceleration <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math>. How does the instantaneous power <math alttext="P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> delivered to the train at time <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> compare to the instantaneous power <math alttext="P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> delivered to the train at time <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="P sub 1 is less than P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="P sub 1 equals P sub 2, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, P sub 1 equals P sub 2, close parenthesis is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>
<math alttext="P sub 1 is greater than P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="P sub 1 is less than P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
